instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GREEN LIGHT NO FAN
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GREEN LIGHT NO FAN - I removed the board from the case and noticed water stains under the fan. When plugged in I could feel heat coming from the area to the right of the fan. <CAPACITOR>C7323</CAPACITOR>. Confirmed the short with a little alcohol. After removing <CAPACITOR>C7323</CAPACITOR> I get fan spin. I do not have another donor board with the exact chip NEd AV7. Would the computer work fine without? Or will I need to track one down? I cant seem to find one of these online.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GREEN LIGHT NO FAN
threads.message:
You can remove similar cap from any Air board.
Get one from CPU area, connected to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> too.

Machine will work without it and supposing that will not have high CPU stress, you can leave it as is.
